1.name: HTML & CSS
1.description: HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is used to structure web content, while CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) is used to style and visually present that content. Mastering both is the first step toward becoming a front-end developer.

documentation.paragraph: Official documentation is essential for mastering HTML & CSS. It provides structured references, detailed explanations, and examples directly aligned with web standards.
points: ✅ Complete list of HTML elements and CSS properties
✅ Trusted source for industry best practices

crashCourses.paragraph: Crash courses provide a fast-paced introduction to HTML & CSS, covering core concepts in just a few hours. These are perfect for absolute beginners or developers needing a quick refresher.
points: ✅ Covers HTML structure, tags, and semantic elements
✅ Explains CSS selectors, flexbox, and grid
✅ Learn by watching and coding along

playlists.paragraph: Full-length playlists offer structured learning paths for HTML & CSS. These curated video series start from the basics and gradually progress to advanced topics like animations and responsive design.
points: ✅ Includes accessibility and responsive design tips

videos.title: HTML Full Course
CSS Full Course
Deploy an HTML & CSS Project (Static Hosting)

projects.paragraph: Building projects is the best way to solidify HTML & CSS skills. Start with simple static pages, then advance to responsive layouts and full front-end designs. Projects help you apply theory to real-world scenarios.

2.name: Advanced CSS
2.description: Advanced CSS focuses on mastering modern styling techniques, utility-first frameworks like Tailwind CSS, and preprocessors like SASS for scalable, maintainable UI. It also includes animations and transitions to create engaging user experiences.

documentation.paragraph: Explore advanced CSS concepts including Flexbox, Grid, custom properties (variables), preprocessors, and utility-first frameworks. Official documentation helps you apply best practices for building responsive and scalable designs.
points: ✅ Preprocessor features like mixins and nesting with SASS/SCSS

crashCourses.paragraph: Crash courses on advanced CSS deliver a quick but powerful dive into modern layouts, animations, and frameworks. Perfect if you want to quickly upgrade your styling skills.
points: ✅ Covers CSS Grid, Flexbox, and responsive design
✅ Learn Tailwind CSS setup and workflow
✅ Animations and transitions for interactive UI

playlists.paragraph: Deep-dive playlists cover advanced CSS and Tailwind through hands-on projects. They walk you step-by-step from setup to building production-ready designs.
points: ✅ Tailwind CSS from setup to deployment

3.name: JavaScript
3.description: JavaScript is a versatile programming language essential for adding interactivity and dynamic behavior to web pages. It allows developers to create responsive user interfaces, handle events, and communicate with servers.

documentation.paragraph: Official JavaScript documentation is the most reliable source to learn syntax, built-in objects, and modern features like ES6+. It provides clear explanations, references, and interactive examples for every level.
points: ✅ Complete reference for JavaScript syntax and APIs
✅ Examples for each concept and method

crashCourses.paragraph: Crash courses help you quickly grasp JavaScript fundamentals. They cover variables, loops, functions, events, and DOM manipulation in a short, focused way.
points: ✅ Covers JavaScript basics to intermediate concepts
✅ Teaches DOM manipulation and event handling

playlists.paragraph: Playlists provide structured, step-by-step JavaScript learning. They cover fundamentals, advanced concepts like closures and async programming, and modern ES6+ features.

projects.paragraph: Hands-on projects help you master JavaScript by applying concepts in real-world scenarios. From basic apps to full web applications, projects solidify your coding confidence.

4.name: TypeScript
4.description: TypeScript is a statically typed superset of JavaScript that adds optional types. It helps catch errors early through a type system and compiles down to JavaScript. Learning TypeScript improves code quality, scalability, and maintainability, especially in large projects.

documentation.paragraph: TypeScript's official documentation is the best place to learn type annotations, interfaces, generics, and advanced typing patterns. It provides in-depth references, examples, and best practices for building robust applications.
points: ✅ Complete reference for TypeScript syntax and types
✅ Practical examples of interfaces, enums, and generics
✅ Guides on configuration and compiler options
✅ Covers integration with frameworks like React and Node.js

crashCourses.paragraph: Crash courses in TypeScript give you a rapid understanding of its core features—types, interfaces, classes, and modules—so you can start using it in real projects quickly.
points: ✅ Introduction to static typing and type inference
✅ Build small projects with type safety

playlists.paragraph: Playlists provide a structured, step-by-step learning path for mastering TypeScript. They take you from beginner-friendly explanations to advanced topics like generics, decorators, and real-world integrations.
points: ✅ Covers generics, enums, decorators, and advanced typing
✅ Integrates with frontend frameworks and backend projects

videos.title: Complete TypeScript Tutorial in English
Complete TypeScript Tutorial in English
Complete TypeScript Tutorial in Hindi

projects.paragraph: Practice your TypeScript skills by building real-world projects. These projects will help you understand how TypeScript fits into larger codebases and improves maintainability.
points: ✅ Apply TypeScript in frontend and backend apps
✅ Build projects with interfaces and generics
✅ Use strict typing to catch errors early

5.name: React.js
5.description: React.js is a powerful JavaScript library for building user interfaces. It allows developers to create reusable components, manage application state efficiently, and deliver high-performance experiences with the virtual DOM.

documentation.paragraph: React’s official documentation is the best resource for learning about components, JSX, hooks, and state management. It offers clear guides, API references, and real-world examples to help you master the library.
points: ✅ Complete reference for React APIs and hooks
✅ Advanced topics like context, reducers, and performance optimization
✅ Best practices for building scalable applications

crashCourses.paragraph: Crash courses provide a fast introduction to React, covering everything from creating your first component to handling state and props in just a few hours.
points: ✅ Learn JSX, components, props, and state
✅ Understand hooks like useState and useEffect

playlists.paragraph: Playlists provide a structured path to master React.js. These include beginner-friendly tutorials, advanced concepts, and integrations like Firebase.
points: ✅ Integrates with Firebase for backend functionality

points: ✅ Authentication and database integration with Firebase
✅ Scalable apps like Netflix and e-commerce clones

6.name: React.js Advanced
6.description: Advanced React covers performance optimization, state management, UI libraries, 3D rendering, animations, and full-stack integration. Mastering these concepts prepares you for building production-grade applications.

documentation.paragraph: Explore advanced React and its ecosystem with official documentation. Learn about server-side rendering with Next.js, UI frameworks like Material UI and Chakra UI, 3D graphics with Three.js, animations with Framer Motion, and data visualization with Chart.js.
points: ✅ Advanced React patterns and performance optimization
✅ UI frameworks: Material UI & Chakra UI

playlists.paragraph: Playlists help you dive deeper into advanced React workflows by combining UI frameworks, animations, and backend integrations. They are structured to move you from intermediate to expert-level applications.
points: ✅ Material UI and Chakra UI component mastery

videos.title: React Material UI Full Series
Chakra UI Tutorial Series
React + Next.js Full Course
Three.js with React Guide
Framer Motion with React
Chart.js with React

projects.paragraph: Apply advanced React by building portfolio-ready projects. These projects combine React with Next.js, Material UI, Chakra UI, animations, 3D rendering, and data visualization.
points: ✅ Responsive UI with Material UI & Chakra UI

resources.title: Responsive UI/UX Website with Material UI
Movie App with Chakra UI & Firebase Auth

1.name: HTML & CSS
1.description: HTML (HyperText Markup Language) defines the structure of extension interfaces like popups, options pages, and side panels, while CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) styles and customizes them for a polished user experience. Mastering HTML & CSS is the foundation of Chrome extension development, enabling you to create responsive and user-friendly UIs inside the browser.

documentation.paragraph: Learning HTML & CSS for Chrome extensions means understanding how to structure and style small yet functional UIs. Official documentation provides element references, styling rules, and responsive layout techniques that are directly applicable to extension popups and settings pages.
points: ✅ Core knowledge for extension popup and options UI
✅ CSS for styling extension elements and layouts
✅ Responsive design principles for browser windows
✅ Beginner-friendly tutorials and advanced design practices

crashCourses.paragraph: Crash courses introduce you to HTML & CSS quickly, helping you learn how to build popup.html files, style options pages, and create layouts for extension UIs in just a few hours.
points: ✅ Learn HTML tags and CSS selectors in practice
✅ Create layouts with flexbox and grid for extension popups

playlists.paragraph: Playlists provide a structured path to mastering HTML & CSS, helping you create popup interfaces, settings dashboards, and styled content scripts for Chrome extensions.
points: ✅ Covers both beginner and advanced HTML & CSS
✅ Teaches responsive design for small popup windows
✅ Best practices for layout and UI design

videos.title: HTML Full Course
CSS Full Course

projects.paragraph: Projects solidify your HTML & CSS skills by applying them in real extension UIs. These projects focus on building functional popups, styled dashboards, and option pages that are ready to be integrated with JavaScript logic later.
points: ✅ Design option pages with responsive layouts
✅ Add polished styling with CSS transitions

2.name: JavaScript
2.description: JavaScript is the core programming language that powers Chrome extensions. It controls interactivity, handles background logic, communicates between popups, content scripts, and service workers, and integrates with Chrome’s extension APIs. Mastering JavaScript is essential to bring your extension’s UI and features to life.

documentation.paragraph: JavaScript documentation helps you understand the language fundamentals and advanced features used in Chrome extensions. From working with DOM in content scripts to managing async operations in background scripts, official resources provide the foundation for writing efficient, scalable extension logic.
points: ✅ Covers core syntax, functions, arrays, and objects
✅ DOM manipulation for popup.html and content scripts

crashCourses.paragraph: Crash courses quickly cover JavaScript fundamentals while introducing practical use cases for Chrome extensions, such as event handling, messaging, and DOM manipulation.
points: ✅ Covers events, DOM, and functions for extensions

playlists.paragraph: Playlists provide a structured path to learning JavaScript, from basics to advanced concepts like async programming, closures, and event-driven architecture—skills that are crucial for Chrome extension logic.
points: ✅ Complete coverage from beginner to advanced
✅ DOM and event handling for extension popups

projects.paragraph: Practicing JavaScript with small projects prepares you for Chrome extension logic. These projects teach event handling, DOM updates, storage usage, and API communication—the building blocks of real extensions.
points: ✅ Work with APIs and local storage

3.name: Chrome Extension Development
3.description: Chrome extension development puts you where users already spend time — their browser. Learning to build extensions helps you create productivity tools, customizations, and integrations directly inside Chrome. It’s a great way to apply your web development skills with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript while learning Chrome-specific APIs.

documentation.paragraph: Documentation is the most reliable way to learn Chrome Extension Development from the ground up. The official resources provide detailed guides on APIs, permissions, and publishing, while additional references explain modern web standards and best practices that strengthen your extensions.
points: ✅ Official reference for all Chrome Extension APIs
✅ Clear explanations of permissions and security
✅ Guidance on publishing and maintaining extensions

playlists.paragraph: Structured playlists walk you through Chrome Extension Development step by step. You’ll learn how extensions work, build popups, connect with APIs, and finally publish them to the Chrome Web Store.
points: ✅ Covers popup UIs, background scripts, and storage
✅ Learn how to call APIs and manage lifecycle events
✅ Publishing your extension to the Chrome Web Store

projects.paragraph: Projects are the best way to master Chrome Extension Development. Instead of predefined projects, use ChatGPT to generate tailored project ideas based on your learning progress and available time.
points: ✅Add APIs like tabs, storage, and alarms (optional — these are also covered in upcoming steps).
✅ Move toward productivity tools with multiple features
✅ Finally, build advanced extensions with React & Firebase

4.name: React.js
4.description: React.js is a powerful JavaScript library for building dynamic user interfaces. It allows developers to create reusable UI components, manage state efficiently, and render changes quickly using the virtual DOM. React is widely used for developing modern web apps, including Chrome extension popups and option pages.

documentation.paragraph: Official React documentation and trusted tutorials provide everything you need to master React. From understanding JSX and components to handling state, props, and hooks, these resources will help you build production-ready applications with confidence.
points: ✅ Official React documentation with detailed guides
✅ Covers JSX, components, props, and state management
✅ In-depth explanations of hooks and lifecycle methods
✅ Guidance on performance optimization and best practices

crashCourses.paragraph: Crash courses provide a quick introduction to React’s core concepts. They cover everything from setting up your first app to using hooks, routing, and state management — perfect for beginners or developers switching to React.
points: ✅ Learn JSX, components, props, and state
✅ Covers hooks like useState and useEffect
✅ Includes small projects to practice concepts

playlists.paragraph: Full-length playlists offer structured learning paths for React. They cover React basics, advanced hooks, context API, state management, and integration with backends — helping you grow from beginner to advanced developer.
points: ✅ Complete beginner to advanced React tutorials
✅ Deep dive into hooks, context API, and Redux

points: ✅ Intermediate projects with routing and APIs

5.name: TypeScript
5.description: TypeScript is a statically typed superset of JavaScript that adds optional types. It helps catch errors early through a type system and compiles down to JavaScript. Learning TypeScript improves code quality, scalability, and maintainability, especially in large projects.

documentation.paragraph: TypeScript's official documentation is the best place to learn type annotations, interfaces, generics, and advanced typing patterns. It provides in-depth references, examples, and best practices for building robust applications.
points: ✅ Complete reference for TypeScript syntax and types
✅ Practical examples of interfaces, enums, and generics
✅ Guides on configuration and compiler options
✅ Covers integration with frameworks like React and Node.js

crashCourses.paragraph: Crash courses in TypeScript give you a rapid understanding of its core features—types, interfaces, classes, and modules—so you can start using it in real projects quickly.
points: ✅ Introduction to static typing and type inference
✅ Build small projects with type safety

playlists.paragraph: Playlists provide a structured, step-by-step learning path for mastering TypeScript. They take you from beginner-friendly explanations to advanced topics like generics, decorators, and real-world integrations.
points: ✅ Covers generics, enums, decorators, and advanced typing
✅ Integrates with frontend frameworks and backend projects

videos.title: Complete TypeScript Tutorial in English
Complete TypeScript Tutorial in English
Complete TypeScript Tutorial in Hindi

projects.paragraph: Practice your TypeScript skills by building real-world projects. These projects will help you understand how TypeScript fits into larger codebases and improves maintainability.
points: ✅ Apply TypeScript in frontend and backend apps
✅ Build projects with interfaces and generics
✅ Use strict typing to catch errors early

1.name: HTML & CSS
1.description: HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is used to structure web content, while CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) is used to style and visually present that content. Mastering both is the first step toward becoming a front-end developer.

documentation.paragraph: Official documentation is essential for mastering HTML & CSS. It provides structured references, detailed explanations, and examples directly aligned with web standards.
points: ✅ Complete list of HTML elements and CSS properties
✅ Trusted source for industry best practices

crashCourses.paragraph: Crash courses provide a fast-paced introduction to HTML & CSS, covering core concepts in just a few hours. These are perfect for absolute beginners or developers needing a quick refresher.
points: ✅ Covers HTML structure, tags, and semantic elements
✅ Explains CSS selectors, flexbox, and grid
✅ Learn by watching and coding along

playlists.paragraph: Full-length playlists offer structured learning paths for HTML & CSS. These curated video series start from the basics and gradually progress to advanced topics like animations and responsive design.
points: ✅ Includes accessibility and responsive design tips

videos.title: HTML Full Course
CSS Full Course
Deploy an HTML & CSS Project (Static Hosting)

projects.paragraph: Building projects is the best way to solidify HTML & CSS skills. Start with simple static pages, then advance to responsive layouts and full front-end designs. Projects help you apply theory to real-world scenarios.

2.name: Advanced CSS
2.description: Advanced CSS focuses on mastering modern styling techniques, utility-first frameworks like Tailwind CSS, and preprocessors like SASS for scalable, maintainable UI. It also includes animations and transitions to create engaging user experiences.

documentation.paragraph: Explore advanced CSS concepts including Flexbox, Grid, custom properties (variables), preprocessors, and utility-first frameworks. Official documentation helps you apply best practices for building responsive and scalable designs.
points: ✅ Preprocessor features like mixins and nesting with SASS/SCSS

crashCourses.paragraph: Crash courses on advanced CSS deliver a quick but powerful dive into modern layouts, animations, and frameworks. Perfect if you want to quickly upgrade your styling skills.
points: ✅ Covers CSS Grid, Flexbox, and responsive design
✅ Learn Tailwind CSS setup and workflow
✅ Animations and transitions for interactive UI

playlists.paragraph: Deep-dive playlists cover advanced CSS and Tailwind through hands-on projects. They walk you step-by-step from setup to building production-ready designs.
points: ✅ Tailwind CSS from setup to deployment

3.name: JavaScript
3.description: JavaScript is a versatile programming language essential for adding interactivity and dynamic behavior to web pages. It allows developers to create responsive user interfaces, handle events, and communicate with servers.

documentation.paragraph: Official JavaScript documentation is the most reliable source to learn syntax, built-in objects, and modern features like ES6+. It provides clear explanations, references, and interactive examples for every level.
points: ✅ Complete reference for JavaScript syntax and APIs
✅ Examples for each concept and method

crashCourses.paragraph: Crash courses help you quickly grasp JavaScript fundamentals. They cover variables, loops, functions, events, and DOM manipulation in a short, focused way.
points: ✅ Covers JavaScript basics to intermediate concepts
✅ Teaches DOM manipulation and event handling

playlists.paragraph: Playlists provide structured, step-by-step JavaScript learning. They cover fundamentals, advanced concepts like closures and async programming, and modern ES6+ features.

projects.paragraph: Hands-on projects help you master JavaScript by applying concepts in real-world scenarios. From basic apps to full web applications, projects solidify your coding confidence.

4.name: TypeScript
4.description: TypeScript is a statically typed superset of JavaScript that adds optional types. It helps catch errors early through a type system and compiles down to JavaScript. Learning TypeScript improves code quality, scalability, and maintainability, especially in large projects.

documentation.paragraph: The official TypeScript documentation is the best resource to learn type annotations, interfaces, generics, and advanced typing patterns. These references guide you in writing safer, cleaner, and more scalable JavaScript applications.
points: ✅ Comprehensive guide to TypeScript syntax and types
✅ Examples of interfaces, enums, and generics
✅ Covers integration with React, Node.js, and other frameworks

crashCourses.paragraph: Crash courses in TypeScript quickly introduce you to its core features, including static typing, interfaces, classes, and modules. These fast-paced tutorials help you start using TypeScript in real projects right away.
points: ✅ Introduction to static typing and type inference
✅ Understand how TypeScript compiles to JavaScript
✅ Build small projects with type safety

playlists.paragraph: Playlists provide a structured journey through TypeScript, starting with beginner-friendly concepts and moving on to advanced topics like decorators, generics, and framework integrations.
points: ✅ Covers decorators, enums, and advanced typing
✅ Integration with frontend and backend frameworks

videos.title: Complete TypeScript Tutorial in English
Complete TypeScript Tutorial in Hindi

projects.paragraph: Practice TypeScript by applying it in real-world projects. These projects help you gain confidence in building scalable, maintainable apps with strong type safety.
points: ✅ Apply TypeScript in frontend and backend projects
✅ Build apps using interfaces and generics
✅ Use strict typing to catch errors early

5.name: Angular
5.description: Angular is a powerful front-end framework developed by Google for building dynamic, scalable, and enterprise-grade web applications. It uses TypeScript, a component-based architecture, and built-in tools like dependency injection and RxJS to create modern, reactive UIs.

documentation.paragraph: The official Angular documentation is the most reliable resource for mastering its core concepts—components, modules, services, forms, routing, and RxJS observables. It provides detailed examples, guides, and references that take you from setup to advanced application development.
points: ✅ Comprehensive guides on components, modules, and services
✅ In-depth routing, forms, and state management

crashCourses.paragraph: Crash courses help you quickly understand Angular’s essentials, including component creation, data binding, forms, and HTTP services. Perfect if you want to get started building Angular apps within hours.

playlists.paragraph: Playlists provide a structured, step-by-step learning journey with Angular. These cover beginner to advanced topics such as advanced components, directives, signals, forms, authentication, testing, and deployment.
points: ✅ Covers Angular CLI, directives, services, and RxJS
✅ Includes real-world use cases and best practices

videos.title: Angular Complete Beginner to Advanced Series

resources.title: Angular Conceptual Playlist + Zero To Advanced

projects.paragraph: Projects are the best way to apply Angular concepts in real-world scenarios. By working on CRUD apps, management systems, and advanced integrations, you’ll master component communication, services, authentication, and deployment.
points: ✅ Build Angular apps using components, services, and routing
✅ Practice with forms, validation, and data binding

1.name: Git & GitHub
1.description: Git is a powerful version control system that tracks code changes, while GitHub is a hosting platform for Git repositories that enables seamless collaboration among developers. Learning both is essential for modern development workflows.

documentation.paragraph: Official documentation is the most reliable source to master Git and GitHub. It covers everything from setting up repositories to advanced workflows like branching, merging, and CI/CD pipelines with GitHub Actions.
points: ✅ Covers essential commands like init, commit, push, pull, and merge
✅ Handling merge conflicts and branching strategies
✅ Best practices for pull requests, issues, and GitHub Actions

crashCourses.paragraph: Crash courses give you a quick yet practical understanding of Git and GitHub. In just a few hours, you’ll learn how to create repositories, make commits, push code, and collaborate on projects.
points: ✅ Fast-paced coverage of Git basics and GitHub interface
✅ Teaches practical workflows and essential commands
✅ Perfect for quick revision before interviews or projects

playlists.paragraph: Playlists offer a complete learning journey for Git and GitHub, starting from beginner-level commands to advanced team workflows. They include practical demonstrations, collaboration examples, and long-term skill building.
points: ✅ Full Git & GitHub workflows: clone, branch, PR, merge
✅ Learn GitHub Actions, Pages, and automation

videos.title: Git & GitHub Crash to Pro in 2 Hours
Git & GitHub Complete Guide (3 Hours)

2.name: Backend (Learning)
2.description: Node.js is a JavaScript runtime for server-side development, Express.js is a web framework for building APIs, and MongoDB is a NoSQL database for storing data. Mastering these technologies is essential for becoming a backend developer.

documentation.paragraph: Official and beginner-friendly documentation helps you master backend development. These resources cover Node.js, Express.js, MongoDB, and related tools like npm and Mongoose.
points: ✅ Express.js routing, middleware, and REST APIs

crashCourses.paragraph: Crash courses provide a quick and practical way to learn backend development. These cover setup, core concepts, and building simple APIs using Node.js, Express.js, MongoDB, and Mongoose.

playlists.paragraph: Playlists guide you from beginner to advanced backend skills, covering authentication, payments, file uploads, GraphQL, and real-time apps with Socket.IO.
points: ✅ Beginner to Intermediate: Core backend concepts
✅ Advanced: Authentication, payments, and file handling
✅ Optional: GraphQL and real-time apps with Socket.IO

3.name: Backend (Practicing)
3.description: Building real-world backend projects is the best way to master Node.js, Express.js, and MongoDB. Start with CRUD APIs, then progress to authentication, payments, and real-time apps.

projects.paragraph: These projects reinforce backend concepts by implementing RESTful APIs, authentication, external integrations, and real-time features.
points: ✅ Perform CRUD operations with MongoDB & Mongoose
✅ Integrate payments, file uploads, and real-time communication
